intro: Dicranoglossum subnudum, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a species of small, evergreen fern-like plant belonging to the family Huperjiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that grow in dense, tufted clusters. This plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Dicranoglossum subnudum has a rhizomatous growth habit, with short, horizontal stems that produce new shoots. Its unique morphology and ecological preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
